website_summaries.verdict: Absorbent walnut-based litter stays clean and scent-free for longer than most.
pros: Walnut shell fibers absorb and trap strong odors
Produces very little dust and minimal to no tracking
Litter lasts longer than most before needing to be replaced
Litter sits at a reasonable price point
cons: Dark, walnut-colored litter can make your cat's fur look quite dirty if they like to sit or roll in their litter

customer_reviews.title: Best one out of the blue walnut litter varieties
customer_reviews.text: I have used blue walnut litter for years. However I find this type (yellow bag) is the best overall in clumping control and smell with little to no dust! I definitely will stick to this one over and over
customer_reviews.author: ETop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I'm so pleased since I purchased this based on reviews. I followed the advice of others and mixed this litter with World's Best litter (which I've been using for years) and the smell is quite strong (earthy) but fades quickly. And it works! It helps to harden up the World's Best clumps and I actually kind of like the smell of the walnut shells. Plus the World's Best lasts longer, which is great. I have not tried this on its own but I'm so happy I tried the mixing!
customer_reviews.author: skelly

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry but this is the worst litter I have ever used. It does not absorb odors well. It does not clump, it crumbles. I am not affiliated with any pet care products or companies but I will say from experience that I am going back to Worlds Best. I really thought that this sounded great but turned out messy and frustrating for me and my cat. Returned rest of product.
customer_reviews.author: Rohonda

customer_reviews.title: Controls odor really well!
customer_reviews.text: This is my all-time favorite litter. It controls odor really, really well-- better than any of the other "natural" products (I've tried swheat scoop, okocat, smartcat...). It clumps well, controls odor, and is good for me, the kitties, and the environment by not being clay :) All three of my cats have happily accepted it. My one issue is that it is dark brown and tracks a bit. It looks a little like dirt. But I recommend it to everyone anyway!
customer_reviews.author: ls

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this litter!
customer_reviews.text: This litter is awesome! I wanted an eco-friendly litter for my cats but the newspaper didn't cut the mustard and neither did the pine litter. All I smelled with urine throughout the house. Not with this litter. Not only do I not smell the urine, it is easy to clean up! It does not have much of a scent but I add some baking soda I have already added some essential oils to and voila! I do not use any more than I did the clay litter (I actually think i use less to be honest) and I am so happy with this litter!
customer_reviews.author: Amber R.

customer_reviews.title: Good smell and odor control, horrible dust.
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this litter from Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter since it is no longer available for subscribe & save. I love that this litter has a subtle natural smell. I feel that it does a good job covering odors without perfumes. But oh my god the dust. It makes scooping the litterbox very difficult because I have to turn away to breathe. It's so bad that I can taste the dust in my mouth. I can't imagine what nuisance it must be for my cat to use it. I will not be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily G

customer_reviews.title: Great for odors, nice clumping, but had mold
customer_reviews.text: I was using clay litter Fresh Step and the World Best Cat litter with a Pet Zone Automatic Self-Cleaning Litterbox for 2 cats but there was always dust around and the smell was intolerable, even when I changed the bag in the receptacle every day. This litter is great on clumping and keeps odors at bay, however, the litter is getting mold after 1 week of cleaning and sanitizing the box and surrounds. I have purchased this litter on the green bag before and did not have this issue. Is it the formula or that I got a bad batch?
customer_reviews.author: GHR

customer_reviews.title: Dustiest litter I've ever used. Stay away if dust is an issue for you!
customer_reviews.text: Dustiest litter I've ever used. Just watch the sequence of photos to see how the dust rises and clouds the camera. Also notice the dust on the shelf on the top this is all from this litter. Terrible that they can advertise this as nearly dust free. Both my cats and I have to breathe and all this dust.
customer_reviews.author: Wessroy

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff and biodegradable
customer_reviews.text: I've been experimenting with various organic, biodegradable litters. I don't like the idea of clogging our landfill (or the incinerator) with clay. I've tried some wood or corn cob litters. Most work fairly well. But this works very well. Easy to handle. Absorbs odor and liquid very well, clumps really well and easy clean up. I wasn't able to clean the box for 11 days and odor absorbtion was still quite good and waste well managed. I think its better than some clumping clay products I've tried and its a little lighter for shipping. Cat has no objections to using it either. Very good stuff
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie W. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to clay litter
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of using a more natural product than clay. Of the various walnut brands I’ve tried, Naturally Fresh is among the best. More expensive, but it performs better. Although he is not picky, the cat doesn’t mind walnut litter at all. Make sure to scoop the catbox regularly. Particularly in humid climates, mold will grow if the clumps aren’t removed daily. I have heard that the mold that can grow with corn-based litter is dangerous to feline health, so I don’t take any chances with the walnut litter and scoop daily.
customer_reviews.author: Canuck-In-DC

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Not a big fan of smells. But, this litter does seem to smell fresher without the perfume smells that normally mask odor (but, never do).. Box smells clean, and makes a little difference from the original formula. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Spiney C. Urchin

customer_reviews.title: quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's a quality control issue or the way it's been stored but this litter smells like moist dirt and had wet clumps inside. We usually purchase ours at petco but ordered a bag on Amazon because we were running low. I would never purchase the litter from amazon again. what a waste of money and litter. My sphynx did not even want to use her box after I poured it in... :( also if you view the image the "walnuts" are almost white not a rich dark brown color as usual.
customer_reviews.author: zombieluv13

customer_reviews.title: Good litter, not good odor control
customer_reviews.text: I liked the clumping and scoopability. My cat had no issues using this litter, but she's never been fickle about litter. I love that it's natural materials. The odor control was not that good. While I was using it, I could not help but pick up a faint "garbage" scent in my apartment no matter whether I had just scooped her box and whenever I traced this scent, I ended up at her litter box, lol! I thought I'd give it a try but it does not live up to my odor control standards.
customer_reviews.author: Oketa

customer_reviews.title: Natural product good for our environment
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter it’s better for our environment than clay. Both our cats have their claws and have no problems using it. It lasts longer than clay litter and absorbs odors just as well. We use the multi cat and it clumps fine and is easy to clean. Maybe not as easy as clay yet when I think of what I’m doing for the environment it’s well worth the extra hassle. I will continue to use this product as long as I can afford to! Thanks Naturally Fresh for a great product even if it’s more pricey than clay!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: A mess and a medium for flies to reproduce.
customer_reviews.text: A huge tracking mess!! Doesn’t clump very well as promised. Flies laid eggs and flourished in this litter. Small flies. Once I figured out where they were coming from (litter box), I was finally able to get rid of the flies by getting rid of this litter.
customer_reviews.author: KathyKinAK

customer_reviews.title: Great clumping and handling of smell - terrible with dust
customer_reviews.text: Love/hate. Great clumping and handling of smell. Tracks like crazy though. Biggest problem is the quality control - some bags barely have any dust whereas others are full of dust that turns our cats' paws brown every time they use it. I'm guessing that's why the reviews are so split - the bag we just opened is a 2-star but others have been 5-star. Updated 10/7 to 1 star: Each batch has gotten dustier and dustier. I practically need to wear a respirator now when cleaning it, and the dust gets into my eyes and nose (I blow my nose and the snot has brown dust in it). This litter used to be amazing but is now unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for training/ strong smell
customer_reviews.text: Worked for training purposes but the smell of the Walnut is so overwhelming especially when it is being combined with kitten bathroom odors.. n it gets everywhere.. our litter of kittens learned quickly to use the litter box but the strong smell was a lot. Cleanup of the litter itselfwas better then other kitten litters I've tried. Also make sure your not allergic to nuts before using this because it will trigger your allergies if so.
customer_reviews.author: Judithkenosha

customer_reviews.title: Gets gunky & funky
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a popular brand clay-based litter containing activated charcoal to this litter, because it's available for Subscribe & Save. After one day, I regretted buying it. This litter does not trap odors at all. It had been years since I smelled that offensively pungent cat urine odor, but this litter reminded me just how well my old litter was working. And while this litter clumps, scooping is very difficult because it forms a sticky paste on the bottom of my cat's stainless steel litter pan. If you want a better performing litter, search out the one with clay granules and activated charcoal. I buy it at a common grocery chain for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer of stuff

customer_reviews.title: I got pellets???
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what was sent to me. I dumped into a bucket before I noticed that what I got was NOT walnut shell litter, like I've successfully purchased before, no. Instead I got walnut shell pellets that do not break down when wet. My cats refuse to use. I suspect it is unpleasant to walk on. I so wished I'd payed attention before opening the bag. Buyer be ware, make sure you get what you actually ordered.
customer_reviews.author: ansabrew

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter. My nose was very tired of the clay mixed with ammonia smell in such close quarters. I love this is all natural, clumping and gives off a pleasant scent, even after being used. I have two cats and clean the box every other day and I hardly ever smell their excrement (unless they've done a poor job at covering it up of course 🙃). I gave 4 stars for ease of cleaning because its a little harder to sift because the walnut prices are larger that Clay so I recommend maybe getting g a bit wider slotted litter sifter. Other than that this is great litter. Definitely sticking with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Peruvianchikita

customer_reviews.title: Good but dusty but good...but dusty. will continue to use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: absorbs and clumps perfectly pleasant, mild smell (literally, walnut husk smell) and excellent odor control cat accepts it eco-friendly Cons: Soooo dusty. A CLOUD of dust if you pour it from the bag. I noticed it doesn't really track around, but the toilet next to the litter box develops a thin, walnut-colored film of dust. Yuck. It's a "feature" of plant-based litter, in my experience; the stuff is just lightweight and friable. Compared to the popular corn litter, this has more dust, but tracks around less. I'll keep using it and keep my eye out for new products.
customer_reviews.author: DeepGreenThumbs

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a small bag of this cat litter since I had a credit. I live in a studio apt and am always looking for a litter that will keep the odors at bay. When I rec'd the 6 lb bag I added it to some clay litter I have been using. Fortunately for me, my 2 adult males took this litter right away. The litter box is in a corner outside the bathroom and, thankfully, there are no odors traveling to the bathroom now! In addition to greatly reducing the odors from the litter box, the clumps in the box are much smaller than with clay litter. Believe me, this litter is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne T. Lucier

customer_reviews.title: So burdened w these everyday choices..
customer_reviews.text: I made the switch from Swheat scoop bcos I think they changed their formula and seemed to be getting more dusty. So Igpt this and the first bag I was impressed w hardly any dust, then second, third, fourth, etc. I’ve noticed more dust. & yes I’m crazy enough to think I got a bag just before they “changed the formula “ lol .. I’ve abt had it and am gonna start looking at other options/alternatives
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Best litter!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter we have found for our two cats. I worried about the clay dust or the dust from the paper litter- that can’t be good for either cats or humans. I don’t know how they do it, but our two cats can track litter all through the house! The Blue Buffalo litter tracks less than any other we have used ( and we have tried many different types). I don’t notice an aroma to the litter, and it does a good job of containing the urine smell. We have been using this product for a while and it is working very well. We will definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it too
customer_reviews.text: I really like how this is odorless litter, clumps well, and tracks minimally. I especially like that my dogs aren’t interested in eating the plain litter, as opposed to what they were doing with the grass seed litters, which most likely are GMO and contain glyphosate! I wish I had found this earlier instead of poisoning my dogs liver and kidneys, not to mention my cat who inevitably would ingest it while grooming. Hopefully the shells don’t contain bad chemicals from spraying the walnut trees but to safeguard my cat I’m putting Mercola’s Liver and Kidney Support in his food.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Decent litter
customer_reviews.text: Not the best litter, but it works. My cats use it. Soft on the paws, little scent out of the bag. However, this product seems to have more dust out of the bag now than when I first started using it. It will also turn to power the more it's used. Tracking is moderate. That seems to depend on the cat. One of mine tracks basically nothing out of the box, my other tracks tons all over. Clumping is pretty good as well. However, I would wait 10 or more minutes to scoop after it's used. Otherwise, wet spots tend to break off. Even still, it has a tendency to crumble and leave particles behind.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this litter hoping it would bring our home a little relief from the oridary litter smell and tracking.It did not. It basically turned into mud balls and our cat(long hair) needed grooming after almost every use of the litter box. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KissimmeeDisney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent natural alternative for cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this cat litter. I always try to find an alternative to the commercial cat litter you normally find sold in grocery / pet stores. The reason is I worry about what I could be inhaling with the dust that always comes up when you clean the box. I also am concerned with the litter’s impact on the environment. The 100% walnut shells is a huge plus for me and it honestly seems to have the same quality of absorbency, scent and cleanliness as the other traditional commercial cat litters. I can’t recommend this enough. I will continue to buy this brand and just hope that Amazon/seller continues to stock this litter!
customer_reviews.author: Truman

customer_reviews.title: Just good litter - clumps well
customer_reviews.text: I mean yeah, I like the walnut smell. It's odor neutralizing to a certain extent. I meaaaan if they just pooped you can smell it, and if you haven't cleaned out the box in a while you can smell it (but I feel like that's on me/you at that point). It clumps when they pee, but then it gets stuck to the bottom of my plastic litter box, and breaks apart into semi-damp flakes, which isn't fun. But I bought this at a great value, and while it's not perfect, particularly on the pee, it does odor neutralize. I'd say like 7/10, which imo is great, worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I am surprisingly pleased with this litter. It clumps well, is absorbent, and as soon as the cat stuff is covered, it completely stops odors. It's very easy to sift, pour, and does not have too much dust. I used to use swheat scoop but I am very concerned about the glyphosate in that. I think this should be devoid of dangerous pesticides. The cats seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This material is thick pellets that work okay for number one but number two just lies on top no matter how much my cats tried to cover it up. The walnut smell was pleasant to me but my cats curled their lips back and were reluctant at first to step in the pan. It left a brown stain in the bottom of the litter pan. Just too weird - going back to my usual brand.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Landress

customer_reviews.title: My New Choice For Kitty Litter
customer_reviews.text: I have been super happy with this kitty litter. I have one cat and she is the smelliest cat on this planet. But when I switched to this kitty litter, I have had no issues at all. In fact, I even keep the lid off of her litter box now to give her more freedom. I literally used to smell her from across the house and now I barely smell it when I’m changing her box. This is the weirdest review I’ve ever written. LOL. Things clump well, scoop well, the excess shakes off easily, and it’s not overly dusty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griffith

customer_reviews.title: it works great. It absolutely keeps the odor out
customer_reviews.text: it works great. It absolutely keeps the odor out. I have it right in the family room in a wire dog crate that I had when I showed my setter so my he will not get in it. No problems with odor or gagging. It clumps great and I absolutely love it. My cat does does not mind and started using it immediately. I threw it right oh top of what I was using until I needed to get rid of all the litter. Seems to be able to use it longer than the others. Wish it was less expensive....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reeeally tracks.  Superior odor control.
customer_reviews.text: I basically love the litter. It has superior odor control. I mean, truly. (I have 4 cats and clean the pan daily (I have a large cement mixing tray that I use as a litter pan that I keep in a closet). And I love the fact that it is a renewable resource. The clumps are not very hard. I could definitely live with that. My only issue is the tracking. I sweep and sweep. I’m very disappointed about it. I’m switching. I I just can’t take the so much litter all in my hallway leading into the bathroom. (And I do have a litter catching mat). Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: xena44

customer_reviews.title: Great for those that have multiple cat Overlords.
customer_reviews.text: I have set up a subscription for this product with Amazon I am so happy with the product. I hardly notice any smell when I enter my apartment with this litter, and I think that would actually be no smell if I was able to clean the litter boxes more than once a week. My only issue is that it doesn't dry as quickly as the silica litter, but when it is dry, it is just as good as the silica. Silica based litter causes me issues, which is why I switched from it more than a decade ago.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. One of my cats has respiratory issues, and we're all sensitive to some perfumes, so all those ridiculously scented litters just don't cut it. I mix this litter with corn litter, and the combination is AMAZING. I've also mixed it with pine, lavender, and a grass based litter. This stuff just performs. It clumps decently as long as you don't shake the clumps too hard. With 2 large cats, as long as I scoop every day or two, I can go about a month between complete litter changes. It's also way less dust than the clay stuff...as for tracking, I've not found a litter yet that doesn't track everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great for number 1, bad for number 2
customer_reviews.text: Low dust, lightweight, clumps enough to be effective. Zero number 1 smell, but terrible for masking number 2 smell. Usually for me, using the usual clay based/type litter, the reverse was true. Unfortunately this issue is a deal breaker for me and I'll continue to look for a better solution. Goal would be low dust, no smell with light weight as a bonus but never really cared about the weight. 3 cats, 2 litter boxes, always used EverClean. Only complaint with it is the high dust.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best kitty litter - hands down!
customer_reviews.text: After trying many litters throughout the 10 years Ive had my cat, nothing compares to this walnut litter. Number one, it’s safe! Number two, it’s cheap! And number three, it works wonders and hides the smell! I will use this forever and I highly recommend you try it as well. My cat took to it right away and my family agrees that this is the only one litter that keeps our home smelling fresh. People always tell me they wouldn’t even know I had pets in my house if they didn’t see them, because my house smells great!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: One of the only clumping litter products that can be used with KITTENS!
customer_reviews.text: It clumps well, the kittens use it easily. I really love this product as it is so cost effective due to the clumping. It has an herbal sent that I found to be a little too strong for my liking. I foster kittens and only once in over a year did I have one kitten decide to ingest this product which ended up with a trip to the vet (some kittens just do this) so I ended up putting a layer of the plain, non clumping, non scented, cheap kitten litter on top of this product and it works well-it still clumps and cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C Oberst

customer_reviews.title: awesome litter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter we've ever used. No smell and it clumps super hard. I'm switching our cats to this litter completely. Also, there is Zero dust with this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag of dust...
customer_reviews.text: Avoid if you don't want to breath clouds of brown dust. Just opening the new bag sends clouds of fine dust out. My sleeves and face were covered. This went immediately to trash. Too bad, because it used to actually be low dust. Called manufacturer and they changed the formula a couple years ago and are trying to fix it...
customer_reviews.author: BubbaChive207

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the s**t! Works fantastically!
customer_reviews.text: I'm super impressed that I can't smell my cat litter box! With 2 Male cats my lord can that box stink, even with scooping it everyday. Since I put this in there, I don't smell a thing! Even when cleaning it out! I expected to get a little whiff of ammonia while cleaning it but there was only the nut smell from the litter. The days of gagging from chemical and ammonia smells while cleaning the cat box are over. Hallelujah! Big plus side I've cleaned the box 3 times since I put it in there.. still haven't had to put more in. It clumps almost perfectly, even with urine!
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great litter
customer_reviews.text: -my 3 cats have used this well, no complaints or disuse of the litterbox from any of them -it is low tracking -it clumps well -seems to be virtually dust free -no scent and seems to keep the urine/BM odors in control (I do scoop the boxes at least 2X/day) -I like that it is compostable (I do add the urine clumps to my compost, the BM's go in the trash) -it seems "slippery" in the box when I scoop, but like I said above my cats have accepted the litter well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Joy E. Goode

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DUSTY
customer_reviews.text: This litter is is extremely dusty. I had previously been using World's Best. At first, I didn't notice how dusty this litter was when it was mixed with with World's Best. However, when It was in the box all on it's own, it put dark brown dust everywhere and my cat's paws were covered in brown dust. This litter is super absorbent and I love the walnut smell. Unfortunately the dust is too much. I'm going back to World's Best Litter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasha is happy and so am I - Cat Litter Approval rating MEOW
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter. It is biodegradable where I live, but you do have to check that out. Due to space conditions, litter box is in a bathroom for a small business. There is no oder, and as it is next to toilet, it is very easy to keep very clean. I have had no dust, but a very small amount of little black dots, which are very easily managed. I have used this litter before Blue took it over and would never us any other. Also, it lasts twice as long as other cat litter and clumps really well. Worth trying and I don't mind it being black.
customer_reviews.author: ArlySing

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant smell, lightweight, environmentally friendly but dusty (red dust).
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Smells pleasant (like a forest), environmentally friendly, light-weight Cons: Quite dusty (yet to find a dust-free litter though) and not very moisture wicking. Clumps well, but box will still be a little wet with urine under the clump. The dustiness doesn't bother me too much because my litterboxes are in my basement and the dust doesn't really track upstairs into my living space. Sometimes my cats do end up with dusty red paws though. But they lick themselves clean eventually (or maybe it just rubs off on my carpet/couch/bed - who knows!!). But i figure it's better for them to ingest small amounts of walnut dust than clay litter dust! Overall I'd recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: discolors my cats paws
customer_reviews.text: It's very very dusty,....and the dust is a reddish brown color. After my cat uses the litter box, his paws are covered in dirty brown dust. I appreciate that it is a natural product, it clumps really well and controls odors well, but I really don't like how dusty it is and that the dirty looking dust seems to get on and stick onto everything it comes in contact with. I won't be buying it again. I think the wood and wheat based litters perform just as well without the dirty dust.
customer_reviews.author: D. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Naturally Fresh Great Litter
customer_reviews.text: We have purchase the non scented Naturally Fresh, and the kitten Naturally Fresh. Both work great, minimal dust, easy clump and clean up. Although I've read reviews where others have problems with tracking I haven't had this problem, and neither have my sons who also use this same litter. The kitten is great for new kittens learning to use the litter box. Have never tried the scented but haven't needed to as there is no odor with the unscented we use. I do, however scoop each litter box daily so that might be part of the reason as well. Would definitely recommend., and have tried several other well known brands.
customer_reviews.author: mamaboys7

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I have ever hated a cat litter as much as this. The smell when wet is horrible, the tracking...ridiculous...its all over my bathroom and through my bedroom. This is definitely the worst i have ever tried. I am really disappointed in how its everywhere, I'll take the litter dust from other litter over this, which doesn't have much anyday.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: My poor cats. Even with daily scooping
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this stuff for a year, with no problems. Lately I noticed it grows mold! Those little pieces that break off when scooping MOLDS! I went on vacation for 3 days and came back, MOLD! I have 5 litter boxes in my garage, and two of them were MOLDY. They were the two with the older litter in it, so I guess it has smaller broken pieces left behind that turned the whole box into a mold bed. Seriously. I couldn't breathe. My poor cats. Even with daily scooping, this stuff will eventually mold a bit because of parts that break off when scooping. So disappointed because this stuff has been great until recently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST LITTER EVER!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Best litter EVER!!! Clumps well (not hard hard but definitely hard enough), little to no dust at all, kitty transition super easy, SOOOO much lighter than other types of litter, pleasant enough smell, tracks LESS than other types of litter, totally biodegradable ... AND BEST OF ALL SOOOOOO ECO FRIENDLY!!!!!!!!!!! EVEN THE COMPANY IS ECO FRIENDLY!!!!!! Have used both single kitty and multi kitty unscented (green and red bags) ~ both seem identical. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Healthier for your cat that has asthma.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since my vet warn me about my cat Choco who might have asthma we act right away did many research online and found this kind of litter. So far It’s being great. Choco hasn't have any episodes since. And it doesnt have much smell and it last a lot longer. Totally suggest people who ran into same problem with their cats to try.
customer_reviews.author: Kouchcat

customer_reviews.title: Very good natural clumping litter.
customer_reviews.text: Very good natural clumping litter for kittens. It clumps fast and doesn't make much dust at all when the kitties scratch, but it does leave brown dust on the walls of the litter box but wipes off easy. Works well in my litter robot 3. It lasts a long time when maintained. I change it out about every 3 weeks. Natural smell and absorbs odors better than others and it doesn't have that strong perfume scent that cheap clay litters have.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: Was initially skeptical because of the price, however, it is completely worth it. We use less and have to change out the whole litter less frequently, thi saving us time, $$ and the inconvenience of breathing in ammonia. I love that my cats aren't exposed to high dust. Product is walnut-based and free of chemicals, grain and clay which means that doesn't track dust in the house or stick to the cats feet. Really controls ammonia odor/levels which is why I went hunting for a new product in the first place. We tried another comparable litter that claims its the best, however, our household prefers Blue Naturally Fresh and the cats appear happy with this formula.
customer_reviews.author: HMF

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed and I had low expectations
customer_reviews.text: I won't speak on my cats' preferences because every cat is different. That being said, we've had this litter a few weeks and I'm unimpressed. It doesn't have a strong odor to it. I don't think it covers up the urine smell very well. It's also not as absorbent, and the clumps break apart when you scoop them. I have searched and read multiple reviews. Best advice I can give is to purchase a smaller package, so you're not out a lot of money if it doesn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Stinky! Stinky! Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this has such good reviews. I have one 5 month old kitten. This litter does not absorb smell AT ALL! I keep getting smelly whiffs of litter when sitting on my sofa, even after cleaning the litter box. I prefer clay litter for absorbing smell. Might be OK if you have a large home and the litter box is in a distant corner of your basement. But if you're like me, and have the litter box in the bathroom or corner of your living room, this is not a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Still has plenty of dust!
customer_reviews.text: I've continuously used this for the past 1-2 years and enjoy purchasing this type of litter over more conventional types. The litter is labeled as being "virtually dustless". I'm not sure what they mean by this though, as I've always noticed significant dust over time with regular use by one cat, and both when cleaning and refilling our boxes. Clumping works very well as long as the litter is fresh (1-2 weeks old). After that amount of time the clumps stay wet for some time and typically crumble while you're shaking the litter through the scoop. I'm sticking with this product, but don't believe the marketing about the dust!
customer_reviews.author: BKRowdy

customer_reviews.title: It's the only litter that we use
customer_reviews.text: Best cat litter ever. Nice odor control (I have five cats and four very large boxes) and clumps very well. Be warned - it is dusty. I pour it in and scoop out very close to the bottom of the boxes to avoid getting a coat of brown dust all over the walls. I usually buy from Chewy but couldn't get it for a few days due to a holiday weekend. Amazon came through with next day delivery and it's the exact same price as Chewy.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE

customer_reviews.title: Don't let my 3 star review discourage you from buying this litter!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has asthma and typical clay litter can aggravate his respiratory system. While this litter is NOT perfect, it is not dusty. He is a naturally big cat, 20 lbs and believe me, his poop can be nasty, but this litter covers up the odor quite well. The litter does NOT clump, it saturates. I have to really manage his litter box for that reason. But his respiratory health is paramount, so we continue to use the litter.
customer_reviews.author: JSV

customer_reviews.title: WORST LITTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst litter I ever used. I only put it in litter pan once and could not wait until it was gone. It is so dusty, the dust gets all over everything in the room. The litter is dark in color and I had to wash the floor and the wall all the time. Smell was not bad and it did control order, but I could not deal with the dirt and dust. I have a bag and a half and do not know what to do with it. I am trying t find out if i can return the full bag for a refund. I am not sure how to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Crouse

customer_reviews.title: IT’S SO DUSTY.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I got this is because it’s foster kitten safe while they’re litter training. It’s SO DUSTY and messy and doesn’t absorb or clump well and it makes the cats sneeze. I’ll be switching the kittens to Dr. Elsey’s as soon as I can. It’s a no from me, dawg.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Lin

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a friend and she says it is the best cat litter she has ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend and she says it is the best cat litter she is ever used! The best that containing odors and for removing of the waste. She's been buying it for the past two years now and she has no complaints! I've noticed that when I go to her house it smells so much cleaner now since she's been using this cat litter. The other stuff she was using was junk compared to this. And most importantly the cats seem to love it also! I hope this review helps, have a great day and God bless!
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Love this litter!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using corn-based litter for several years. I don’t believe silicone-based litter is good for cat health. The biggest benefit to the corn-based litter was how light it was in weight. I could not get the corn litter delivered in time and so went with this walnut-based litter. I absolutely love it! It is amazing at soaking up orders! I will not go back to corn! ( I have two cats and two litter boxes.)
customer_reviews.author: SargeQ

customer_reviews.title: Best litter on the market - No telltale litter odor and so lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this litter for over 6 years. Prior to finding it, I tried every type on the market for 5 years and was never happy with ANY of them. The scented ones with the smell of the feces was most disgusting and they are were so heavy. I have recommended this to every cat owner I know and they have switched to it. If you scoop every day, you will be amazed that there is no odor and it’s lasts much, much longer than all other brands I tried. I am on auto delivery every three months and have never need more...in fact. I should switch to every 4 months. Fantastic product! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: New formula- DUST STORM
customer_reviews.text: I use to love this litter but after my last 2 bags I decided to contact the company directly. I noticed the clumping was better but the increase of dust has far exceeded the clumping improvement. The new formula grains are much smaller and about 1/3 of the bag is almost a powder consistency. Now I having to mop my floors almost every week and my cat started vomiting almost daily because the dusty liter she has to clean off her paws.
customer_reviews.author: Jj-

customer_reviews.title: The blue bag is the best cat litter I have used!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a VERY sensitive nose, so if there is ANY strong odor, I am sneezing my head off, same as dust. NO DUST OR STRONG ODOR! I smell a light scent of walnuts, but it pleasant. No dust when I filled cat box Clumps very well- I clean litter box before I go to bed After cleaning, still has a light pleasant smell I have one or two prices of cat litter that comes out with the cat, but no trail I love this product and will never go back to name brand cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Owens

customer_reviews.title: Less then Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this Cat litter, to say the least. The litter is eco friendly however that is the only benefit I found. It is an absorbent litter, therefore, and I found that it needs to be changed out every 2 or 3 days. This is due to the fact the litter becomes the consistency of thick mud which my kitties do not appreciate or will use! The product has no odor reducing qualities and it also tends to be very messy as far as tracking on the floor is concerned. I would not recommend this product nor do I plan to purchase it again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Clements

customer_reviews.title: It was great, now it sucks
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. This has been my favorite and my cats' favorite litter for 3 years, but something has changed. The clumps stay wet and fall apart when I scoop them, contaminating the rest of the litter with that nasty ammonia smell. It's now worse than clay litter and the cost is ridiculous, where it used to save me money because it lasted so long. There used to be no smell and it lasted for weeks. Now it lasts 3 days and I have to toss all of it and wash the litter boxes. There was MOLD covering the surface of one of them. I have to wonder if this is why Blue Buffalo removed their name from it.
customer_reviews.author: Llux

customer_reviews.title: Way too much dust!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this litter can claime to be dust free. There are clouds of brown dust every time I scoop it. It's so bad that it gets on my cloths and I have to clean my glasses. It also has a bit of a musty smell that I find unpleasant. It clumps well and otherwise is a good litter, but the dust is just too much for me to deal with. I have been using sWheet scoop and this litter clumps a bit better, but has at least twice as much dust.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: and clumps like nobody's business
customer_reviews.text: I have been a faithful user of Blue Buffalo for about 4 years now. It covers up smell SO WELL, and clumps like nobody's business. My cat loves it, and can go about a week at a time without scooping. A few times I've forgotten to order it in time (because one of these big bags lasts me over a month), and had to buy something else at the store. I'm reminded every time I do this why I love Blue Buffalo. Other clumping brands are smelly, awful, and expensive for what you are getting. I have to scoop every day with other brands, and my house still smells. Blue Buffalo is the absolute best.
customer_reviews.author: susannah white

customer_reviews.title: it clumps really tight
customer_reviews.text: I thought my BFF was crazy when she started ranting to me about how good this litter she uses is until she showed it to me. "THE CLUMP IS SO TIGHT," she kept yelling, and she was 100% right. This litter clumps tight. Even the pee-iest of cats have met their match. We have too many and this litter keeps our house smell-free. It's so good that I've started ranting to people about it. They think I'm crazy, but someday I'll start carrying around a sample so they'll see the truth.
customer_reviews.author: julesy

customer_reviews.title: Way to go, Blue Buffalo!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS the BEST cat litter ever! The odor control is superior to a previous brand I had, PLUS, it DOESN'T coat my cat's paws or bum leaving prints all over like the afore mentioned litter did. And the price listed for the 14lb bag is not to be found anywhere I looked, at least not since the time of my order (June 2017). May I highly recommend the litter if you're looking for something all natural, long lasting, and DUST FREE. =-)
customer_reviews.author: Anne Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great Natural Odor Control & Dusty!
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for great odor control without using fragrance! However, this stuff is really dusty! I mean something terrible. Carl sneezes every time he's doing his business and his white fur is stained brown. I had to clean the vent fan cover and window screen due to dust stains after we quit using thus litter.
customer_reviews.author: James Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Good smelling dust-free cat litter
customer_reviews.text: We tried the vast majority of the clay-based litters, the new synthetic blue micro-crystal stuff, and the Tidy Cat Breeze System (my cats thought those ceramic pellets were toys), and nothing was that great. We finally settled on this walnut-based cat litter. It is the nicest smelling of the bunch, clumps easily, and closest thing to dust free. The biggest downside is it tracks EVERYWHERE. But given the alternatives, I'm happy to run the vacuum a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L

customer_reviews.title: Tried them all...
customer_reviews.text: & this is our favorite litter BY FAR! The red or yellow multi-cat varieties are the absolute best. Great value given how well it works & how long it lasts. I have (2) 15 lb cats & this is a really great product. I’ve tried all varieties of clay (don’t like for MANY reasons), crystal/Gels, coconut, corn, etc. Have bought more bags than I could count & this point & have ZERO intention of ever changing! I’ve even spread the word to family members who are now using it as well. Simply can’t say enough good things about this litter! Must try!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crickle

customer_reviews.title: I honestly hated this litter
customer_reviews.text: I honestly hated this litter, sadly. My entire apartment is covered in a fine layer of brown dust and this litter tracks the worst of all the kinds I’ve tried (clay, corn, paper, synthetic, wood). I live in a studio so even my pillow covers (furthest from the litter box possible) were stained with brown dust and pieces of litter. It also doesn’t clump tightly and is hard to scoop because the clumps break easily and the dust is overwhelming! Giving it two stars because I did like the idea of the walnut shells and the litter itself had a pleasant smell to it. Unfortunately, it did not control odor that well.
customer_reviews.author: ellee

customer_reviews.title: 7 out of 7 cats approve
customer_reviews.text: This lasts way longer than corn based cat litter, clumps faster and so are more scoopable, and holds in the scent so it doesn't spread around the house. I also happen to like the color but that's just a bonus. Cats didn't need any transition period or mixing of the old and new litters to get used to it. I changed the entire box and they were using it right away.
customer_reviews.author: juan ovakyn

customer_reviews.title: Lighter weight. Clumps about the same as clay
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t notice any big difference between this and the clay litter as far as how hard it clumps. I do like that it is lightweight because I have arthritis and I use a sifting pan to sift the litter box. My cat adjusted just fine but I slowly switched on him adding walnut litter to the clay each time I scoop out. I think he likes the new litter better. But I wasn’t sure how it would go with him being a picky cat. It makes it much easier to care for my fur baby.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Leaves little dust!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a corn based litter but the yellow dust was everywhere and the walnut based litter is so much better. It leaves very little dust which makes it much easier to clean the area around the litter box!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol T. Cook

customer_reviews.title: All natural cat litter
customer_reviews.text: The litter is firm clumping and does a good job with odor control. The litter is quite dusty; both when pouring and cleaning. The litter is also dirty and my white kitty constantly has brown paws, and I find wherever the cats scratch there is a brown tint. I do, however, like that’s it’s all natural and there are no added scents/chemicals so I’ll probably continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cammie

customer_reviews.title: Best litter I've used.
customer_reviews.text: For a litter that's unscented, it's the best lack of smell ever. I started using this based on feedback from a rescue I foster cats through, and I'm glad I did. It works exceptionally well at keeping smells to a minimum. I also appreciate not choking on dust when trying to scoop the messes out. A little bit more expensive than the litter we were using, but I can scoop and top off with this and reuse for up to a month before needing to completely dump and start over, one bag lasts at least 3 weeks with 3 litter pans so we actually end up spending less per month.
customer_reviews.author: Jamesp

customer_reviews.title: Works well, smells fine, but wish it were less dusty
customer_reviews.text: Although this is definitely the best we've found of the not-dangerous-for-your-cat-to-inhale varieties, this is also pretty dusty. No more dusty than clay and less dusty than some other "healthy" varieties (World's best, other corn/wood/nut-based litters), so I'm not sure dust is avoidable. Masks smell with a nice woody scent and clumps easily, so, overall, best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Evan H

customer_reviews.title: horrible litter
customer_reviews.text: This litter is not worth paying for. It kinda clumps, but retains a hideous, overpowering odor that lingers in your air. I don't think my cats, Taco and Meoweowe like it either. This litter is a don't buy product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad 4 a natural litter but not the best by far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a World's best fan but my order was delayed So I tried this product. It does smell clean at opening,it absorbs & clumps.. almost to much,it was difficult to scoop after just one day use with just one cat. It definitely is not the odor absorber it claims.. all in all not bad natural for the price.be prepared 4 alot of scrapping. It failed to convert me from worlds best.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnie

customer_reviews.title: You won't go back to regular clay litter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have four cats and that means I clean the box every day. This stuff is great, it absorbs the odor instantly and it clumps everything together for easy clean up. The cats were not to sure of it at first but no problems using box. One bag last me at least a month with two boxes and daily cleanup. I won't ever go back to clay litter.
customer_reviews.author: Odies mom

customer_reviews.title: Potential allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: Although this litter does clump well, and controls odor...please be aware this is made from nuts and is a potential allergen... My cats developed an allergic reaction, both became very itchy... licking their paws continually, lots of scratching.. one cat developed sores on her paw before we finally figured it out with the help of our vet ($150 !!) who had seen it on other cats using this litter ... an expensive litter indeed 😕
customer_reviews.author: RT jack

customer_reviews.title: It’s so awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was having eye issues from the heavily perfumed cat litter I was previously using. My house also smelled like the cat litter perfume, which I hated. Enter these crushed walnuts... and I’m happy I have cats again. No heavy smell, no cat box smell, easy to clean, lighter and easy to scoop. I’m so happy I found this. Go natural!! Try it out, you and your cat will be happier (and healthier)
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The BEST litter we have ever used
customer_reviews.text: There is no smell to the litter. We have used this for several years and were thrilled to dee it online. During these times, its great not to leave my home or have to reuse what litter I had. My cat is 8 and has never used anything else! We had used clay with other cats and there is much less litter leaving the cat box with this walnut based litter.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN RAY

customer_reviews.title: Clumps Well and Smells Earthy!
customer_reviews.text: Got the red bag of this and oh my goodness! I got this litter after trying to find a litter that would clump better than what I had been using. I was changing cat litter every four days and it was awful. I decided to try this litter, I was hesitant because of some of the reviews and I was worried but I tried it and I couldn’t be happier! It smells very Earthy, obviously it’s natural. I like it a lot. It also clumps REALLY WELL. Everything comes out. The urine just comes right out and it’s amazing. I’m beyond happy. Definitely will continue to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Is Better
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I have a multi cat household. People walk in and are shocked they don't "smell cat". Most don't know I have pets unless one graces us with their attitude. lol Seriously my baby is a fat tuxedo with asthma. I had used everything on the market and it all made him sick. I started using walnut litter before it became a "great thang". It works great. I think the walnut actually helps to absorb smells in the home as well.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Frey

customer_reviews.title: Cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Liked this at first. Came highly recommended at a local pet store. Found over time I couldn't scoop the clumps of urine without them falling apart and start to stink. Mom had the same experience. Tracks very easily also on the paws. I would find this litter as far as across the living room into the dining area. Have a 2 bedroom apartment don't need the cat urine funk smell.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Best natural litter by far
customer_reviews.text: Best natural litter we’ve ever used, lasted 3 times longer than corn cob or other natural litter we’ve used. Blows away arm and hammer, swheat scoop, blue buffalo, and litter mate natural litters
customer_reviews.author: lizzette

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty suffered with all kinds of nasal issues. We had her on all kinds of meds with several years of repeated visits to the vet. Now, we can't say for sure if it was switching to Blue Buffalo cured her but she stopped having issues after the first large bag of this litter. It has been almost a year with no issues and we are not taking any chances by changing cat litter!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Monasco

customer_reviews.title: My cat refused to use
customer_reviews.text: Basing the review on my cat's likes. She has used several different types of litter without any issue but she refused to use her litter box when I used this. Needless to say that caused issues. Had to throw it all out
customer_reviews.author: vicki andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cat love it!  Really keeps down odors
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this stuff for a couple of years now and it's been great. As long as the cat buries its waste (not always guaranteed, as many cat owners know) the odors are very effectively trapped. As a bonus since this litter is made from walnut shells it means the feces is flushable! I wouldn't do it with a pee ball, though.
customer_reviews.author: Walt H.

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient clumping, wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a clumping natural litter option, but this definitely isn't it. While I found it had good odor control (though the scent of the litter itself is always noticeable), it did not clump solidly enough to clean out neatly, and therefore the odor became a problem as the clumps broke up. Also, it stuck to the bottom of the box, which was a pain to clean out. It's not the worst natural option I've encountered, but I would not buy it again. (For what it's worth, I haven't found a natural litter that clumps really well, so we use the Simply Pine pellets, which have great odor control and don't get tracked all over the house.)
customer_reviews.author: Kay Anne

customer_reviews.title: Clumps but does not waste excess. One bag goes a long way.  TOO MUCH TRACKING.
customer_reviews.text: Still some tracking but no dust and no smell. Clumps but does not waste excess. One bag goes a long way. Works well with the Litter Robot Open Air. UPDATE: Have switched to a normal clumping type. This one continued to track AND it stains. We ended up with stains on beds, carpets, etc. Too much tracking/scatter for us. Too bad it didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Walnut litter is great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this walnut litter with my cats since they were 3 months old. One of my cats has kitty asthma and even though this litter can be a bit dusty it doesn't seem to set her off like the clay litters do. And it clumps well and contains the smell fairly well, without irritating perfumes (which will set off her kitty asthma). 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Matchgirl42

customer_reviews.title: The Best!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely thrilled with this litter! I am so sensitive to smells and the miwute the box was used I smelled it. I do scoop daily but still couldn't get past the smells. I was using the breeze system which I found to be the best until now. I still use the system and the pee falls through w some dirty litter and a little clumps so I scoop and change the pad. I find NO smell with this and my litter is on the main floor. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie L

customer_reviews.title: Better than clay...from a long time cat lady
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't stand the smell of clay litter, and the mess that it made. The crystal litter was no better. When someone told me about walnut-based litter I figured I would give it a shot. Not only does it not smell like clay and crystal based, it lasts a LOT longer. I can just scoop instead of having to clean and disinfect the box multiple times a week. Saved on my lysol costs as well. :) Definitely worth the price, and from a trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cash

product_meta.title: Naturally Fresh Walnut-Based Multi-Cat Quick-Clumping Cat Litter, Unscented, 26-lb bag
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Multi-Cat Unscented| Size:26 lbNEW! Improved Multi-Cat Litter Now Neutralizes ALL Odors Naturally Fresh has always outshined both the clay and natural litter competition in neutralizing ammonia odors, but it just made its premium walnut shell blend even better. That’s thanks to a counteractant that tackles both urine and fecal smells, an ideal feature for households with multiple cat kids. Naturally Fresh improved Multi-Cat formula: • Neutralizes both urine and fecal odors • Is fragrance-free • Creates tight clumps fast, making scooping easier • Includes softer granules [Instructions for Use] • Fill a clean litter box to the recommended level of three inches of Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Litter. This quick-clumping formula forms an easily removable clump of waste when wet. Remove with a scoop and discard according to your local regulations. • Maintain cleanliness by removing clumps and solid waste daily. Add more litter, as needed, to stay at the recommended level of three inches. • It is recommended that you clean and sanitize your litter box every 30 days to keep a fresh and healthy litter box for your cat kid. Based on a single-cat household, Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Litter should last at least 30 days between changes, or as needed, for odor control. [Transitioning Your Litter to Naturally Fresh] • Start by placing one to two inches of Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Litter in a clean litter box. • Top dress with enough of your current cat litter to cover Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Litter. • Each time you change the litter, reduce the amount of your current litter. • It typically takes one or two changes for most cats to be comfortable with a new litter. [Precautions] Note: Wash hands thoroughly after handling used cat litter. Cat feces may carry parasites that can cause toxoplasmosis. Pregnant women and people with suppressed immune systems should avoid contact with used cat litter.
feature_bullets: An exclusive cat litter formula made from the fibrous material of the walnut shell, Naturally Fresh neutralizes litter box odors better than clay, pine, corn, and wheat litters.

Because Naturally Fresh is proven to absorb 3x better, one bag is equal to three bags of the leading clay litter. Our super-absorbent formula produces tight clumps in as little as 15 minutes, making cleanup easy and mess-free.

Unlike clay litters that throw off silica dust, Naturally Fresh is silica dust-free so you and your cat kid can breathe easy. It also doesn’t stick to your cat’s paws, so litter won’t be tracked through your home.
All natural and 100% biodegradable, Naturally Fresh is made from walnut shells, an annually renewable, non-food agricultural product.
Made without any harmful ingredients, Naturally Fresh is safe for you, your cat kid, and the environment.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,327 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
